Player History
Drafted in 7th round, 134th overall pick, by St. Louis in 1966...
Released by St. Louis on 8/14/1966...
Drafted in 1st round, 7th overall pick, by California in 1967...
Injured on 6/3/1968 with a Strained Back Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 5/1/1969 with a Dislocated Shoulder, out for 10 weeks...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/1/1971, off Herm Starrette (BOS)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/16/1971, off Fritz Peterson (NYY)...
Injured on 5/17/1971 with a Strained Back, out for one week...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/16/1971, hitting .579 with 1 HR, 5 RBI...
Was selected to the 1972 Allstar game...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1972...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1973...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1975...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/29/1976, hitting .565 with 2 HR, 2 RBI...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1976...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1977...
Injured on 4/13/1978 with a Pulled Hamstring Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/11/1978, hitting .550 with 0 HR, 5 RBI...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1978...
Signed as a free agent by Cleveland on 2/23/1980 to a 4-year deal worth $774,000 per year...
